.
Handling the Claimant’s Waiver of a Hearing Transcript
If the claimant gives permission
not
to prepare a typed transcript of the hearing,
ask the claimant to submit a signed, written statement with the following wording at the hearing or – in the case of a videoconference hearing – as shortly thereafter as possible:
I hereby waive any requirement that the record of my hearing will be transcribed.  A hearing transcript will be prepared if my records are eventually referred to BVA for a decision on this issue
, and
secure any tape recording or other electronic record in the claims folder for a period of at least two years after the hearing, at which time it will be recycled or destroyed.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart v, Chapter 1, Section D  - Regional Office (RO) Hearings
